info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 11 at 12:31PM PDT until August 12 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...Very Low RH and Gusty Winds in FWZs 284...285...And 624 Thursday and Friday afternoons and evenings... .Gusty south to southwest winds combined with very low RH will lead to critical fire weather conditions this afternoon and evening and, likely, again Friday afternoon and evening across portions of south central Oregon and northeastern California. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR STRONG GUSTY WIND WITH LOW RH FOR PORTIONS OF FIRE WEATHER ZONES 284 AND 285 IN CALIFORNIA AND PORTIONS OF FIRE WEATHER ZONE 624 IN OREGON... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM TO 9 PM PDT FRIDAY FOR STRONG GUSTY WIND WITH LOW RH FOR PORTIONS OF FIRE WEATHER ZONES 284 AND 285 IN CALIFORNIA AND PORTIONS OF FIRE WEATHER ZONE 624 IN OREGON... The National Weather Service in Medford has upgraded the Fire Weather Watch to a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 2 PM to 9 PM PDT Friday. * Impacts: Strong, gusty wind with low relative humidity and critically dry vegetation will greatly increase the spread potential of any new and existing fires. * Affected area: In Northern CA, the northeastern portion of Fire Weather Zone 284 including Lava Beds and Tule Lake as well as northern and eastern portions of Fire Weather Zone 285 including the Modoc Plateau, areas near and east of Alturas, and the Warner Mountains. In South Central OR, the southeastern portion of Fire Weather Zone 624 including much of Winter Rim, Bonanza, Bly, Lakeview, and Valley Falls. * Wind: Southwest 10 to 20 mph with gusts 25 to 35 mph. * Humidity: 7 to 15 percent. * View the hazard area in detail at: https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD * View the hazard area in detail at: https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD Precautionary/preparedness actions... Avoid tossing burning cigarettes on the ground, parking hot vehicles on dry vegetation, and using equipment that can cause sparks. Follow all fire restrictions. Find links to restrictions at weather.gov/medford/wildfire. One less spark, one less wildfire. Gather your fire evacuation kit now. Collect essentials you don`t want to lose and prioritize your checklist. Visit ready.gov/kit for more information. Familiarize yourself with your evacuation plan. Where will you go? How will you get there? Who will you call to let others know your are safe? Visit ready.gov/wildfires for more information. A Red Flag Warning does not mean there is a fire. It means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now or will shortly. These conditions promote rapid spread of fire which may become life threatening. Evacuate if ordered to, or if a fire threatens. &&
